New Records: Kylian Mbappé scored his first-ever goal at a European Championship.
Robert Lewandowski became just the third player to score in four different editions of the UEFA European Championship after Cristiano Ronaldo and Luka Modric.
Lewandowski is the only player to score at each of the last four Euros (2012, 2016, 2020, 2024).

France had 55 touches in Poland’s penalty area in this match – only England against Denmark in Euro 2020 (56) has a side had more touches in the opposition box on record (since 1980) in a game at the UEFA European Championship.

N’Golo Kanté has lost none of his 11 games at the UEFA European Championship (W6 D5), the joint most appearances made by a player in the tournament's history without ever ending on the losing side (level with Spain’s Xavi – W8 D3).

Antoine Griezmann made his 33rd appearance for France at a major international tournament (Euros/World Cup), with only goalkeeper Hugo Lloris (35) playing more games for Les Bleus in the two competitions combined.
Key Match Events: Kylian Mbappé scored from the penalty spot early in the second half.
Robert Lewandowski equalized for Poland with a penalty after a VAR review.
Ousmane Dembélé and Théo Hernández missed key chances for France.
Mike Maignan made crucial saves against Piotr Zielinski and Kacper Urbanski.
Lukasz Skorupski denied Mbappé on two one-on-one occasions before halftime.
Didier Deschamps made a triple substitution shortly after France took the lead, which included withdrawing N’Golo Kanté.
Pre-Game Insights: Kylian Mbappé returned ahead of schedule to lead the line for France despite suffering a broken nose against Austria.
France needed to win the game to have any chance of finishing top of Group D.
Post-Match Reflections: France finished second in Group D and will face the runners-up from Group E in Düsseldorf.
France are now on the same side of the draw as Spain, Portugal, and Germany.
France failed to win their final group stage match at a major tournament for the ninth consecutive tournament.
France have plenty of questions to answer and improvements to make if they are to go deep in the tournament.
Poland were already eliminated from the tournament and played with the shackles off.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is the first time France have failed to win their group at a major international tournament (Euros/World Cup) since Euro 2012.
Poland remain winless in their last eight UEFA European Championship matches (D4 L4).
Poland avoided defeat in a game in which they conceded first for just the third time at the Euros.
